sense.name: a storage facility where things can be deposited
sense.examples: They have built a repository for nuclear waste. The grocery store has separate repositories for cans and glass bottles.

sense.name: someone to whom a secret is entrusted
sense.examples: The priest was the confessor's only repository. Jane was the frequent repository of her sister's schemes and secrets.

sense.name: burial vault for prominent person
sense.examples: The body of the king is apparently no longer housed in this repository. The repository for the 14th-century knights is beneath the floor of this church.

sense.name: amount of accumulated natural resource
sense.examples: This land does not have access to sufficient repositories of water for irrigation. That nation has abundant repositories of oil and natural gas.

sense.name: source of information or knowledge
sense.examples: John's mind is a rich repository of baseball lore and statistics. Libraries have served as great repositories of knowledge for centuries.
